name: Texas Data Privacy and Security Act

conditions.description: Does not qualify for small business exemption

rules.message: Sensitive data under TDPSA requires explicit consent unless exemption applies
rules.remediation: Implement explicit consent mechanism for sensitive personal data processing

rules.message: Processing of known child data must comply with COPPA requirements
rules.remediation: Implement COPPA-compliant consent mechanisms for children under 13

rules.message: Targeted advertising processing requires opt-out mechanism
rules.remediation: Implement clear opt-out mechanism for targeted advertising

rules.message: Sale of personal data requires opt-out mechanism
rules.remediation: Implement opt-out mechanism for sale of personal data

rules.message: Personal data collection must be limited to what is adequate, relevant, and reasonably necessary
rules.remediation: Review and limit data collection to necessary purposes only

rules.message: Processing for purposes not disclosed requires consent or compatibility assessment
rules.remediation: Obtain consent for new purposes or demonstrate purpose compatibility

processingActivityAnalysis.description: System analyzes each processing activity against TDPSA requirements
validationProcess: Validate consent mechanisms for sensitive data
Assess opt-out mechanisms for sale and targeting

assessmentQuestions.question: Does your business have presence or conduct business in Texas?
assessmentQuestions.help: This includes physical locations, employees, or regular business activities in Texas

assessmentQuestions.question: Approximately how many Texas residents' personal data do you process annually?
assessmentQuestions.help: Include customers, employees, vendors, website visitors, etc.

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you sell personal information to third parties?
assessmentQuestions.help: Sale includes sharing for monetary or other valuable consideration

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you process personal data for targeted advertising?
assessmentQuestions.help: Targeted advertising displays ads based on personal data obtained from consumer's activities

assessmentQuestions.question: Which types of sensitive personal data do you process?
assessmentQuestions.help: Sensitive data requires explicit consent under TDPSA

assessmentQuestions.question: How do you currently share personal data with third parties?
choices: We don't share personal data with third parties
assessmentQuestions.help: Different sharing practices have different TDPSA requirements

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you have written contracts with service providers who process personal data on your behalf?
assessmentQuestions.help: TDPSA requires specific contract terms with processors

assessmentQuestions.question: How many consumer rights requests have you received in the past 12 months?
assessmentQuestions.help: This helps assess your current rights management processes

assessmentQuestions.question: What opt-out mechanisms do you currently provide?
choices: We don't currently provide opt-out mechanisms
assessmentQuestions.help: TDPSA requires accessible opt-out mechanisms for sale and targeted advertising

assessmentQuestions.question: What security measures do you have in place for personal data?
assessmentQuestions.help: TDPSA requires reasonable security practices appropriate to the nature of personal data

assessmentQuestions.question: Do you have procedures in place for responding to data breaches?
assessmentQuestions.help: TDPSA requires breach notification in accordance with Texas Business & Commerce Code Section 521.053

assessmentQuestions.question: What elements does your current privacy policy include?
choices: Categories of third parties with whom data is shared
How consumers can exercise their rights
We don't have a privacy policy
assessmentQuestions.help: TDPSA requires specific disclosures in privacy notices

categories.name: Transparency Requirements
categories.description: Obligations to provide clear privacy notices to consumers

categories.name: Consumer Rights
categories.description: Rights that must be provided to consumers under TDPSA

categories.name: Data Processing Requirements
categories.description: Fundamental principles governing how personal data may be processed

categories.name: Sensitive Data Processing
categories.description: Special requirements for processing sensitive personal data

categories.name: Contract Requirements
categories.description: Required contractual protections for data sharing and processing

categories.name: Security Requirements
categories.description: Technical and organizational measures for protecting personal data

requirements.title: Privacy notice must be reasonably accessible, clear, and conspicuous
requirements.description: A controller shall provide consumers with a reasonably accessible, clear, and conspicuous privacy notice
requirements.details: A controller shall provide consumers with a reasonably accessible, clear, and conspicuous privacy notice that includes the required disclosures under the TDPSA.

complianceChecks.description: Create TDPSA-compliant privacy notice with all required elements
Ensure privacy notice is easily accessible to consumers

requirements.title: Privacy notice must describe categories of personal and sensitive data processed
requirements.description: Privacy notice shall include comprehensive information about data processing activities
requirements.details: A privacy notice shall include the categories of personal data and sensitive data processed by the controller, the purpose for processing personal data, categories of personal data shared with third parties, categories of third parties with whom personal data is shared, and how consumers may exercise their rights.

complianceChecks.description: Include comprehensive data processing disclosures in privacy notice

requirements.title: Changes to privacy notice require notification
requirements.description: Controllers must notify consumers of material changes to privacy practices
requirements.details: A controller shall notify consumers of any changes to the privacy notice before processing personal data for purposes not disclosed in the privacy notice in effect at the time of collection.

complianceChecks.description: Implement notification process for privacy notice changes

requirements.title: Right to access personal data
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to confirm and access their personal data
requirements.details: A consumer has the right to confirm whether a controller is processing the consumer's personal data and to access the consumer's personal data.

complianceChecks.description: Implement process for handling access requests within required timeframe
Maintain systems capable of locating and extracting consumer's data

requirements.title: Right to correct inaccurate personal data
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to correct inaccuracies in their personal data
requirements.details: A consumer has the right to correct inaccuracies in the consumer's personal data, taking into account the nature of the personal data and the purposes of the processing of the consumer's personal data.

complianceChecks.description: Implement process for correcting inaccurate data

requirements.title: Right to delete personal data
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to delete their personal data
requirements.details: A consumer has the right to delete personal data provided by or obtained about the consumer.

complianceChecks.description: Implement deletion process considering legal grounds and exceptions
Ensure technical capability to delete data across all systems

requirements.title: Right to data portability
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to obtain their data in a portable format
requirements.details: A consumer has the right to obtain a copy of the consumer's personal data previously provided to the controller in a portable and, to the extent technically feasible, readily usable format that allows the consumer to transmit the data to another controller without hindrance, where the processing is carried out by automated means.

complianceChecks.description: Implement data export functionality in machine-readable format

requirements.title: Right to opt out of targeted advertising
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to opt out of targeted advertising
requirements.details: A consumer has the right to opt out of the processing of personal data for purposes of targeted advertising.

complianceChecks.description: Implement opt-out mechanism for targeted advertising
Technical systems to honor opt-out preferences

requirements.title: Right to opt out of sale of personal data
requirements.description: Consumers have the right to opt out of the sale of their personal data
requirements.details: A consumer has the right to opt out of the sale of personal data.

complianceChecks.description: Implement opt-out mechanism for sale of personal data
Technical systems to prevent sale after opt-out

requirements.title: Data minimization
requirements.description: Controllers must limit collection to what is necessary
requirements.details: A controller shall limit the collection of personal data to what is adequate, relevant, and reasonably necessary in relation to the disclosed purposes for which the data is processed.

complianceChecks.description: Review and limit data collection to necessary purposes only
Document necessity justification for each data element collected

requirements.title: Purpose limitation
requirements.description: Controllers may not process data for incompatible purposes without consent
requirements.details: A controller may not process personal data for purposes that are not reasonably necessary to or compatible with the disclosed purposes for which the personal data is processed, unless the controller obtains the consumer's consent.

complianceChecks.description: Obtain consent for processing incompatible with original purposes
Document purpose compatibility assessments

requirements.title: Reasonable security practices
requirements.description: Controllers must implement reasonable security measures
requirements.details: A controller shall establish, implement, and maintain reasonable administrative, technical, and physical data security practices to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and accessibility of personal data.

complianceChecks.description: Implement comprehensive security controls appropriate to data sensitivity
Document security measures and conduct regular assessments

requirements.title: Non-discrimination
requirements.description: Controllers may not discriminate against consumers exercising their rights
requirements.details: A controller may not process personal data in violation of state or federal laws that prohibit discrimination against consumers nor discriminate against a consumer for exercising their rights under the TDPSA.

complianceChecks.description: Establish non-discrimination policies and procedures
Train staff on non-discrimination requirements

requirements.title: Consent for processing sensitive data
requirements.description: Processing sensitive data requires explicit consent
requirements.details: A controller may not process sensitive data concerning a consumer without obtaining the consumer's consent, or, in the case of the processing of sensitive data concerning a known child, without processing the data in accordance with the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act.

complianceChecks.description: Implement explicit consent mechanisms for sensitive data

requirements.title: Definition of sensitive data
requirements.description: TDPSA defines specific categories as sensitive data requiring special protection
requirements.details: Sensitive data includes personal data that reveals racial or ethnic origin, religious beliefs, health diagnosis, biometric data for identification purposes, genetic data, precise geolocation data, contents of communications to which the controller is not a recipient, and personal data collected from a known child.

complianceChecks.description: Identify and classify sensitive data in processing activities

requirements.title: Contract requirements for processors
requirements.description: Controllers must have written contracts with processors
requirements.details: A controller that discloses personal data to a processor shall enter into a contract that sets forth instructions for processing personal data, the nature and purpose of processing, type of data subject to processing, duration of processing, and rights and obligations of both parties.

complianceChecks.description: Implement comprehensive processor agreements with required terms

requirements.title: Processor restrictions
requirements.description: Processors must adhere to controller instructions and assist with TDPSA compliance
requirements.details: A processor shall adhere to the controller's instructions and shall assist the controller in meeting obligations under the TDPSA, including data security and breach notification.

complianceChecks.description: Monitor processor compliance with contractual obligations

requirements.title: Subprocessor requirements
requirements.description: Processors must obtain controller approval for subprocessors
requirements.details: A processor shall provide a controller with reasonable opportunity to object before engaging a subprocessor, and shall ensure the subprocessor is bound by a written contract with the same obligations as the processor.

complianceChecks.description: Implement subprocessor approval and contracting process

requirements.title: Data breach notification
requirements.description: Controllers must provide breach notification in accordance with Texas law
requirements.details: A controller shall provide notice to consumers of a breach of system security as defined by Section 521.053, Business & Commerce Code, in accordance with that section.

complianceChecks.description: Implement breach detection and notification process per Texas Business & Commerce Code
Maintain breach response procedures and notification templates

requirements.title: Data security requirements
requirements.description: Security practices must be appropriate to the data and business context
requirements.details: Security practices shall be appropriate to the volume and nature of the personal data at issue and the size and complexity of the business and its operations.

complianceChecks.description: Implement risk-based security controls scaled to business operations
Conduct regular security assessments and updates

considerations: Demonstrated good faith efforts to comply

injunctive_relief.description: Attorney General may seek injunctive relief to prevent violations

small_business.description: Businesses meeting SBA size standards for their NAICS code are exempt from TDPSA
small_business.criteria: Must meet Small Business Administration size standards based on NAICS code
small_business.additional_criteria: Alternative exemption for businesses with fewer than 100 employees AND less than $10 million annual revenue

employee_data.description: Limited exemption for employment-related data processing
employee_data.scope: Data processed solely for employment purposes within the controller's organization

public_information.description: Publicly available information is excluded from TDPSA coverage
public_information.scope: Information lawfully made available to the general public

regulated_entities.description: Entities already subject to specific federal privacy regulations may have limited exemptions

cure_period.description: Businesses have 30 days to cure violations after notice from Attorney General
cure_period.conditions: Only available if violation is cured and reasonable written plan provided to prevent future violations

effectiveDates.small_business_determination: Based on SBA size standards in effect at time of assessment

compliance_timeline.immediate: Data minimization, purpose limitation, security requirements
compliance_timeline.within_90_days: Privacy notice updates, consumer rights processes
